com.esri.mo2.src.sys
Interface Connection

All Known Implementing Classes:
ArcIms4Connection, FileSystemConnection, SdeConnection
public interface Connection

An interface Connection provides the access information necessary to connect to a Source. Since access information is connection-specific, the details are not defined here, but are left to individual implementations. Usually, the access details are passed as parameters to the constructor of a Connection implementation.

There is also a need to support access to data at design-time within a Java IDE. This is handled as follows:

  • all Connection implementations must also have a null constructor
  • the toString() method must return a String that contains all necessary access details
  • the setConnection() method accepts a String in the form provided by toString() and must populate itself with the access details provided by that String
  • a design-time component can therefore prepare code that obtains the Connection class using Class.forName(), instantiates it using Class.newInstance(), obtains the setConnection method using Class.getMethod() then populates the Connection instance by calling Method.invoke() and passing the details String as parameter.
A Connection must be able to construct the corresponding Source via constructSource(). Normally this will be invoked by the SourceCache, whenever appropriate. Here is a typical sequence of events for obtaining a Source through the SourceCache: 
   Connection connection = new ConnectionImplementation(connection-specific parameters...);
   Source source = SourceCache.getSource(connection); // SourceCache may call Connection.constructSource()
   if (!source.isConnected()) // a cached Source may already be connected
       source.connect();
   ....
   source.disconnect();

See Also:
Source, SourceCache

          a Connection must implement hashCode() to match the results of equals(), in order for SourceCache and CatalogModel to locate Connection objects within a HashMap

Method Detail

constructSource

public Source constructSource()
construct the Source corresponding with this Connection

Returns:
the relevant Source

equals

public boolean equals(Object object)
this equals() functions the same way as Object.equals() but must not test for object equality (x == y). Implementations should test that the given object has the same implementation class as this Connection, then check that the Connection parameters are identical - or equivalently, the values returned from toString() are equal.

Overrides:
equals in class Object
Parameters:
object - the other object to be compared for equality
Returns:
true if considered equal, false otherwise
See Also:
Object.equals(java.lang.Object), toString()

hashCode

public int hashCode()
a Connection must implement hashCode() to match the results of equals(), in order for SourceCache and CatalogModel to locate Connection objects within a HashMap

Overrides:
hashCode in class Object

toString

public String toString()
a Connection object must provide a String that can be used to reconstruct the Connection at a later time. Each Connection class must provide a constructor that accepts the result of Connection.toString() in this case, the original Connection and the newly constructed Connection will be considered "equal" in terms of the equals() method.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the connection String
See Also:
equals(java.lang.Object)

setConnection

public void setConnection(String details)
                   throws Exception
populates this Connection instance with the specified details, which must have the format produced by this Connection's toString()

Parameters:
details - the connection details
Throws:
Exception - if the details are ill-formatted
See Also:
toString()
